ralgorithm

Class Combing

  • java.lang.Object
    • ralgorithm.Algorithm
      • ralgorithm.Combing

  • public class Combing
extends Algorithm
    Transforms a Source Robot, S, into a Target Robot, T, in O(n) parallel steps

    Basic outline of Algorithm is as follows:

    1. Melt S down
    2. Tranform S to line through a series of oneTunnels
    3. Do a reverse transformation of T to target from combed from line

    Combing Algorithm was created by Greg Aloupis, et. al.

    Since:
    2/14/2016

    • Constructor Detail

      • Combing

        public Combing(Robot s,
               Robot t)
        Init function for combing algorithm, note that robots must be in [x][y] up, right positive direction.

        Initializer enqueues all moves in the full tranformation and then q gets polled for states

    • Method Detail

        Determines if the algorithm has finished executing

      • determineNextStates

        public java.util.List<State> determineNextStates()
        Description copied from class: Algorithm
        Determines the next n states of the robot in the algorithm

        Often used so that some algorithms can contain other algorithms and determine next states through those lagorithms

        Default method just calls an implementations determinePMove and runs it.

        Overrides:
        determineNextStates in class Algorithm
        Returns:
        A list of robot states to render next
